venue.name: Northeastern University [John O'Bryant African American Center]

item.description:
The Boston Latino International Film Festival will be holding the opening reception/night at Northeastern University's John O'Bryant African American Center. The opening reception will be free to attend and will include free food from Jose's Mexican Restaurant. There will also be drinks available for purchase [beer/wine at the minibar upstairs]. Come and mingle with other Latino movie lovers and even movie directors before the opening film.  The opening reception will be from 5:30 to 6:30 PM.

-------------------------

Opening program will begin at 6:45 PM and will include:

Luminaris / Spain / Juan Pablo Zaramella / 2012 / 6min / Short

Long Distance / Cuba / Esteban Insausti / 2010 / 93min / Narrative Feature
Insausti explores the dramatic emotional impact of the mass exodus of Cubans to the US through the story of a woman who finds that she has lost all of her friends to this crisis.

-------------------------

Second program will begin at 9:00 PM and will include:

The Perfection in your hand / Spain /Guillermo P. Bosch / 10min / Short

Mayan Renaissance / Guatemala / Dawn Engle / 2012 / 68min / Documentary
Describes the ancient Maya civilization, the conquest by Spain during the 1520s, hundreds of years of oppression, and the modern struggle by Mayans for self determination and a Mayan renaissance. The film contains interviews of 1992 Nobel Peace Prize winner, Rigoberta Menchú, a Mayan indigenous rights activist and politician, and other Guatemelan and foreign contributors.

Co-Presented by: Boston Area Spanish Exchange (BASE)

--------------------------

For more information, please visit www.bliff.org for complete film schedules and ticket information. Tickets will be available for purchase at location.  See you guys there! :)
